ch.aplu.android

Class GGConsole

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.aplu.android.GGConsole

  • public class GGConsole
extends java.lang.Object
    GGConsole is used to display a simple black screen to display lines of text like in a common system command shell. Lines too long to fit the screen are wrapped and the text will scroll up when the screen is full. Using the vertical scroll bars at the right border the text can be scrolled up and down. The screen orientation is fixed to PORTRAIT. All GameGrid toast messages are automatically displayed in in the GGConsole window.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GGConsole()
      Creates an Activity with a special console layout.

      • println

        public static void println(java.lang.String text)
        Writes one line of text. The next call will display the text on the next line.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to show.

      • clear

        public static void clear()
        Clears the content of the console.

      • requestInput

        public static java.lang.String requestInput(java.lang.String title,
                            java.lang.String prompt,
                            java.lang.String init)
        Halts the main thread and shows the modal dialog box and a Ok and Cancel button. When the Ok button is pressed, the current text in the edit field is returned (empty string, if the field is empty) and the main thread continues to run. The screen orientation is fixed to what is was before, even when the screen is rotated while the dialog is shown.
        Parameters:
        title - the title text of the dialog box
        prompt - the prompt text of the dialog box
        init - the text shown in the edit field when the box pops-up
        Returns:
        the text in the edit field; null if the Cancel button is pressed
